text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

) The title of this IRM was changed from “AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Non-Examined Closures” to “AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Non-Examined and Deleting AIMS Records.” (
) The information contained in IRM
, Missing Returns and Error Accounts, dated May
, has been incorporated into this IRM and therefore, it is being obsolesced. (
) Editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses, form references, and IRM references were reviewed and updated as necessary.
The information contained in IRM 4.4.20, Missing Returns and Error Accounts, dated May 1, 2003, has been incorporated into this IRM and therefore, it is being obsolesced.
changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses, form references, and references were reviewed and updated as necessary.
Other significant changes to this IRM include the following:

Section Description Moved the section Non-Examined Closings from IRM 4.4.21.2 and renamed “Surveys”. Deleted Disposal Codes 36, 38, 41 and added Disposal Codes 42 and 43. Added reference to disposal IRM 4.4.21.5 code definitions. IRM 4.4.21.5.2 Added Form 4251 and deleted Form 10904. IRM 4.4.21.5.1.3 Added instructions for Form 4251. IRM 4.4.21.5.1.4 Renumbered from 4.4.21.2.2.1. Renumbered from 4.4.21.2.2.2. Deleted Form IRM 4.4.21.5.1.3 10904 instructions. Deleted disposal codes and integrated the infor- mation within the chapter. Added section on Types IRM 4.4.21.5.2 of Returns. IRM 4.4.21.5.2.1 Added instructions for closing a paper case file. Added group instructions for paperless case file IRM 4.4.21.5.2.2 closures. Added PSP instructions for paperless case file IRM 4.4.21.5.2.3 closures. IRM 4.4.21.5.2.4 Added blocking series information. Created single section referencing Disposal of the IRM 4.4.21.6 Form. The prior IRM had multiple sections. IRM 4.4.21.7 Renumbered from 4.4.21.3.7.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
IRM 4.4.21, dated January 1, 2003 is superseded. Content in IRM 4.4.20, Missing Returns and Error Accounts, has been incorporated in this IRM. Therefore IRM 4.4.20 is being obsolesced.

Closures and Deleting AIMS Records 4.4.21
Certain conditions prevent closing a case as non-examined. The condition must be resolved before a data base can be closed as non-examined.
Other than the Transaction Code (TC)

credit that must be resolved before the case can be closed as non-examined, leave other credits on the module. The credits will be systemically moved to the Unapplied Statute Credits Account after the refund statute expires. See IRM
, TC
, for information.
Records closed and then reopened cannot be reclosed as non-examined. See IRM 4.4.26, Reopening/Reclosing/Reinputting Records.
You cannot close a case as non-examined if there is an amount in the EXAM- ASSESS-CUM-AMT field on page two (2) of the AMDISA.
Records cannot be closed non-examined if there is an advance payment, TC 640, on the module. The TC 640 must be resolved.

) If the TC
was used in error, reverse the TC
and post the correct action as appropriate by submitting Form

) If the payment was posted to the incorrect module, determine the correct or tax period and input a credit transfer. See IRM
, Credit Transfers and Reprocessing Returns, for procedures on credit transfers. (
) If research indicates the TC

posted correctly but there is no correlating posted or pending assessment on the module and the assessment statute piration date (ASED) is imminent, determine whether a quick assessment is required. Take all appropriate measures to ensure that any required assess- ment is posted to the account and/or assigned a timely document locator number (DLN) prior to the expiration of the ASED.
) A case cannot close as non-examined if there is a TC
or TC
freeze (
) AIMS (Freeze Code “-A”). Amended Return Freeze (
) Generally, the amended return or duplicate return must be secured to determine the correct disposition of the case.
) All Partnership Control System (PCS) linkages must be released before the (
) investor return can be surveyed. Partnership Investor Control File (PICF) PCS Linkages Codes
and
prevent the premature closing of the investor return until all necessary flow-through adjustments from the key case(s) to the investor have been resolved. (

) Command Code (CC) TSCLS releases the freeze on AIMS to allow the input of CC AMSOC. When CC TSCLS is entered, it will automatically check all of the investor’s linkages to determine if they have been closed. If all linkages have been closed, then CC TSCLS will set the PN-SUM-CLOSED-IND on partner record and the PICF-CD to a closed status on the PCS and AIMS bases. When the “Request Completed” message is transmitted to the the operator can proceed to enter the CC AMSOC. (

) Should all linkages not be properly closed, upon input of the CC TSCLS the error message “Cannot Close, PCS Control” will be displayed on the screen. Secure a CC TSUMY print, attach it to the closing request and route the file back to the originator. The file should be suspensed by the appropriate function. Coordination with the Area TEFRA coordinator in Technical may be required to transfer the file to the Campus TEFRA function.
) AIMS Freeze Codes A - T, V, W, Y and
must be released before the (
) can be closed. AIMS Freeze Code (
) AIMS Freeze Codes U and X will not prevent a non-examined closure. (
) AIMS Freeze Code Z will prevent a non-examined closure if the disposal is

) There are times when a record is established on AIMS incorrectly or ously and must be deleted. AIMS Records - (

) An account would be considered an erroneous opening, if, for example, the wrong year was opened on AIMS/ERCS (Examination Return Control or incorrect taxpayer information was entered (the TIN used was for a other than the one selected for examination). (
) If a return was received as a result of the erroneous opening, it should be refiled under its current DLN and the AIMS controls closed as an error account. DC
does not generate a refile DLN. Note: There is never a need to refile an electronic print. The electronic print be shredded. (
) Form
, Request for Deletion from AIMS, must be completed in full. (

) A detailed explanation and sufficient documentation should be provided to Use AIMS/ERCS Analyst to explain why the account should be considered an erroneous opening. A list of the Area/Campus AIMS/ERCS personnel can found at: http://wsep.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/co/dcse/sbse/exam/webdocuments/ Document%

) All records can be deleted on the same day they were input.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
For true error accounts, complete Form 10904 to request the record deleted.
You must wait 15 days form the Opening-Creation date (or 30 days if push code is 036) before requesting that the record be deleted.
This section provides procedures for missing or unlocatable returns.
Closures and Deleting AIMS Records

) On examination cases where the original return is missing, every attempt should be made to locate the return if the examination cannot be Missing using an electronic print. Note: LB&I Imaging Network (LIN) Images are considered original returns for purposes of this section. (

) If the return is not received within two months from the initial request, a follow-up request should be performed. If there is information on the return charge out or on IDRS controls indicating the return is in another function, contact the function/employee to determine if the return can be forwarded Examination. (
) If the return was received and subsequently lost, special searches must be performed. (
) If it is determined that an examination is not warranted, the account can be approved for closing. (
) The Form
must be prepared and all supporting documentation Update to Status Code
and forward the package to the Area Analyst. (
) Accounts should not be closed without a written request on Form
signed by the requester and the requester’s manager. Sufficient must be attached that allows the AIMS/ERCS analyst to evaluate the request. (
) A current transcript (TXMODA, IMFOLT, or BMFOLT), AMDISA full display, TC
skeletal record and/or Form
, Examination Return Charge Out Sheet, is required for all requests to delete the AIMS record. If a follow-up request for the return was input, appropriate documentation should also be attached. (
) Disposal Code
(Missing Return) will be used. (
) The AIMS/ERCS Analyst will review the missing return research and advise management of any potential statute problems. (
) If the AIMS/ERCS Analyst determines the group/function has taken all priate actions, the AIMS/ERCS Analyst should approve the Form
, update to Status Code
, and forward it to the field territory manager or designee. Approval is required by the field territory manager or designee unless Form
indicates the return was never received. After approving/ signing the Form
, field territory manager will return it to the analyst for input. (
) If the AIMS/ERCS Analyst determines the group/function has not taken all propriate research actions, Form
will be updated to Status Code
returned to the requester with additional actions to be taken notated on the form.

If the AIMS/ERCS Analyst determines the group/function has not taken all ap- propriate research actions, Form 10904 will be updated to Status Code 10 and returned to the requester with additional actions to be taken notated on the
AIMS Procedures and Processing (
) The approved Form
should be forwarded to the terminal input area closure. Unless area instructions provide otherwise, the forms will be in searchable order, by the AIMS/ERCS Analyst for one year following (

) If it is determined that an examination is warranted or is already in and all attempts to locate the return are unsuccessful, and an electronic Warranted not sufficient, contact with the taxpayer should be made to secure the in Progress necessary information in order to complete the examination. This could be copy of the return, claim, examination report, etc. (

) If the original return was received and subsequently lost, or if the return examined and the case file cannot be located, the following procedures will used to reconstruct the case file when a copy cannot be secured from the taxpayer: a. The examining function will prepare a “DUMMY” return and annotate the top of the return “ORIGINAL DESTROYED/MISSING/LOST”. b. The file must include documentation to support the preparation of the “DUMMY” return, specifically information on the efforts made to locate missing/lost return. c. The file must also contain an electronic print of the account, a copy of examination report, and a current AIMS print. (
) Close the examination using normal procedures. Identify the closure as “Closed Using a DUMMY.” (
) This section provides procedures for closing cases where no return has filed and an examination is not warranted. (

) For area closures, the complete package will be forwarded to the Area ERCS Analyst following the area procedures. (

CC AM424D with a Disposal Code 36 through 41 will generate a TC 59X which will close the Master File controls. If a disposal code is not input, and there is a TC 59X at Master File, it will remain open.

4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
Three forms can be used to request a non-examined closing:
Enter the two digit disposal code on the form. Attach the prepared Form
to the return or electronic print. Only one type of tax (Master File Transaction-MFT) can be used on Each form can be used to transmit up to
closings when the MFT is same. Additional pages can be attached so that up to

closings of same MFT can be transmitted at the same time. If more than one page is used, indicate the page number and the total of pages (maximum of five) in the upper right corner of the form. More than one disposal code may be used. Enter the requester’s initials, organization routing symbols and date. Attach the “Audit” label of the case being closed. Enter the two digit disposal code in the lower left of the label below you do not have a label, write “DC XX” (where XX is the disposal code) lower left corner of the block for that specific taxpayer. After closing each case through AIMS (CC AMSOC), note the side of
with the IDRS employee number, date, and document sequence
If more than one page is used, indicate the page number and the total number of pages (maximum of five) in the upper right corner of the form.
After closing each case through AIMS (CC AMSOC), note the side of Form 5351 with the IDRS employee number, date, and document sequence number.

) Occasionally, due to program problems, records are unprocessable which means the only way to remove the record is to request a “ZAP.” This is a special utility that only the IDRS User Support Staff at the campus can See the following link for the contact list for the campus IDRS user sup- port:http://wsep.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/co/dcse/sbse/exam/webdocuments/Document%

List.xls (
) Approval by SB/SE Headquarter AIMS Analyst must be secured before the ZAP request can be completed. (

) Follow local procedures on obtaining the ZAP approval. Some Area offices request the ZAP approval before they submit the paperwork to the IDRS Other offices have the IDRS staff request the ZAP approval. (
) ZAP approval will not be given if the AIMS record can be removed in any manner such as CC AMSOC/CC AMCLS or allowing the AIMS record to off of the data base. (
) Form
, Request for Taxpayer Information, is used to request an be zapped. (
) Attach the following supporting documentation to the request: a. Current IDRS printout of AMDISA b. Written explanation of the zap request c. IDRS number of the requester
